item.description: 今天的时事通讯将探讨华尔街顶级银行为何退出曾经颇受欢迎的气候联盟。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at why Wall Street’s top banks are quitting a once popular climate alliance. item.title: 拜登禁止在美国大西洋和太平洋地区进行海上石油钻探
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）无限期地阻止在美国沿海超过 6.25 亿英亩的水域进行海上石油和天然气开发，并警告说在那里钻井 "不值得冒风险"，而且 "没有必要 "满足美国的能源需求。【原文：President Joe Biden is indefinitely blocking offshore oil and gas development in more than 625 million acres of US coastal waters, warning that drilling there is simply “not worth the risks” and “unnecessary” to meet the nation’s energy needs.】

item.title: 越南有毒空气表明需要采取更严厉的除烟措施
item.description: 越南首都数周来一直笼罩在有毒空气中，周五的一项指数使河内短暂成为世界上污染最严重的城市，这给当局施加了压力，要求采取更严厉的行动来解决烟雾问题。【原文：Vietnam’s capital has been blanketed in toxic air for weeks with one index briefly making Hanoi the world’s most-polluted city on Friday, putting pressure on authorities to take tougher action to tackle the smog.】

item.title: 西北欧为冰雪天气做好准备，天然气库存将消耗殆尽
item.description: 本周欧洲西北部的冰冻天气将进一步对天然气库存造成压力，而该地区南部和东部则会出现反常的温暖天气。【原文：Freezing weather across northwest Europe this week will put further pressure on gas inventories, while the south and east of the region will be unseasonably warm.】

item.title: 中国碳价今年将面临盈余压力
item.description: 中国的碳市场今年将扩大到更多的污染行业，但持续的过剩和规则改变后旧许可证的到期可能会减缓2024年的价格上涨。【原文：China’s carbon market is set to expand to cover more polluting industries this year, but a persistent surplus and the expiry of old permits following a rule change may slow a price rally seen in 2024.】

item.title: 风能现在是英国最大的电力来源，而天然气则降至十年来的最低点
item.description: 英国的风力涡轮机首次超过燃气发电厂，成为第一大电力来源，但距离到 2030 年实现清洁电网的宏伟目标还有很长的路要走。【原文：The UK’s wind turbines have overtaken gas plants for the first time as the number one source of electricity, though they’re still a long way from ambitious targets for a clean grid by 2030.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 2024 年，全球一篮子主要大宗商品均有所上涨，部分原因是黄金走势强劲。咖啡和可可是原材料中表现最好的，这让巧克力爱好者和咖啡饮用者非常懊恼，因为他们渴望更低的价格。美国最大储存中心的原油库存已降至 2007 年以来的季节性最低水平。【原文：A basket of the world’s key commodities rose in 2024, helped in part to gold’s stellar run. Coffee and cocoa were top performers among raw materials, much to the chagrin of chocolate lovers and coffee drinkers yearning for lower prices. And crude oil stockpiles at the largest US storage hub have fallen to the lowest seasonal level since 2007.】

item.title: 大型冬季风暴威胁美国中部部分地区
item.description: 预报员说，周日，一场破坏性的冬季大风暴席卷美国中部地区，带来了冰雪和气温骤降的可怕组合。【原文：A major, disruptive winter storm was sweeping across the central U.S. on Sunday, forecasters said, bringing with it a dreaded combination of snow, ice and plunging temperatures.】

item.title: 大雪导致英国全境交通中断，黄色预警依然存在
item.description: 随着新年伊始的寒冷持续，一夜之间的大雪给英国各地的出行造成了严重影响。【原文：Heavy overnight snow has created significant travel disruption across the UK as the cold start to the new year continues.】

item.title: 大雪导致英国交通中断并发出天气警告
item.description: 新年伊始的寒冷天气仍在继续，一夜之间的大雪给英国各地的交通造成了干扰。【原文：Heavy overnight snow was causing disruption across the UK as the cold start to the new year continued.】

item.title: 特朗普抨击英国北海能源政策的 "重大失误
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周五在社交媒体上发文抨击英国对石油和天然气生产商征收暴利税，这是他即将上任的政府对英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）施政纲领的又一次批评。【原文：US President-elect Donald Trump hit out at the UK’s windfall tax on oil and gas producers in a social media post Friday, adding to criticisms from his incoming administration of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s agenda.】

item.title: 华尔街顶级银行刚刚放弃了一个曾经很受欢迎的联盟
item.description: 在短短一个月内，华尔街最大的银行退出了全球金融界最受欢迎的俱乐部之一。【原文：Within the span of a month, Wall Street’s biggest banks have quit what had been one of the most popular clubs inside global finance.】

item.title: 爱尔兰召开应急计划会议，为暴风雪做好准备
item.description: 爱尔兰将于本周六晚些时候遭遇 "多重危险天气事件"，政府应急计划小组正在召开会议，为这一事件做好准备。【原文：The government's Emergency Planning Team is holding a meeting as Ireland braces for a "multi-hazard weather event", which is due to hit the country later on Saturday.】

item.title: 2025 年九项气候决议
item.description: 从减少塑料的使用到在高温下寻找安全的锻炼方式，您可以通过多种途径制定自己的气候行动计划。今天的时事通讯为您提供了九个想法，供您添加到您的新年决心清单中。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道。【原文：From cutting plastics use to finding safe workouts in the heat, there are a number of ways you can create your own climate action plan. item.title: 拜登将禁止在美国大西洋和太平洋的大片水域进行新的石油钻探
item.description: 乔-拜登总统将下令禁止在美国沿海约 6.25 亿英亩的土地上开发新的近海石油和天然气，禁止出售大西洋和太平洋水域以及墨西哥湾东部的钻井权。【原文：President Joe Biden is set to order a ban on new offshore oil and gas development across some 625 million acres of US coastal territory, ruling out the sale of drilling rights in Atlantic and Pacific waters as well as the eastern Gulf of Mexico.】

item.title: 澳大利亚准备应对酷热天气，南部地区可能发生火灾
item.description: 澳大利亚当局已向该国东南部和西部地区发出酷热警告，称墨尔本的恒温器预计将在周日达到 38 摄氏度（100.4 华氏度）。【原文：Australian authorities have issued extreme heat warnings for southeastern and western parts of the country, saying the thermostat in Melbourne is forecast to reach 38C (100.4F) on Sunday.】

item.title: 英国在黄色天气警告下准备应对大雪和冻雨
item.description: 本周末，英国大部分地区将遭遇大雪和冻雨袭击，可能导致交通中断，同时还将发布两次黄色天气预警。【原文：Large parts of the UK will be hit by heavy snow and freezing rain which could lead to disruption this weekend amid two amber weather warnings.】

item.title: 全球可持续债券销售额第二次达到 1 万亿美元
item.description: 在创纪录的绿色和可持续发展票据销售的推动下，2024 年全球可持续发展债券的年发行量第二次达到 1 万亿美元。【原文：Annual issuance of global sustainable bonds reached $1 trillion for the second time in 2024, fueled by record sales of green and sustainability notes.】

item.title: 大雪在选举认证前威胁华盛顿
item.description: 一场横扫美国中部的暴风雪有可能在周一向华盛顿降下几英寸厚的积雪，在国会计划对总统选举进行认证的这一天，通勤路途可能会变得湿滑。【原文：A storm sweeping across the central US is threatening to dump several inches of snow on Washington Monday, potentially making for a slippery commute on the day Congress is scheduled to certify the presidential election.】

item.title: 拜登放宽对价值数十亿美元的氢能补贴的规定
item.description: 拜登政府放松了对用于氢气生产的价值数十亿美元的税收减免的一些严格保障措施，因为有公司认为这些规定会扼杀氢燃料的国内生产。【原文：The Biden administration loosened some stringent safeguards on a tax credit worth billions of dollars for hydrogen production, after companies argued the rules would stifle domestic manufacturing of the fuel.】

item.title: 今年气候领域的看点
item.description: 随着我们许多人重返工作岗位，准备开始新的一年，今天的时事通讯将探讨能源市场、消费者支出和外交将如何塑造 2025 年地球的未来。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上找到我们的完整预测列表。【原文：With many of us back at work and ready to start a new year, today’s newsletter looks at how energy markets, consumer spending and diplomacy will shape the future of the planet in 2025. You can find our full list of predictions on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 农业初创公司 Plenty 正洽谈削减 90% 以上的估值
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，获得杰夫-贝索斯等亿万富翁支持的垂直农业先驱 Plenty Unlimited Inc.【原文：Plenty Unlimited Inc., a pioneer of vertical farming that’s drawn backing from billionaires including Jeff Bezos, is in talks for a new funding round that will virtually wipe out existing stockholders, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 电动汽车减税可能吸引中国进入价值 270 亿美元的南非产业
item.description: 南非总统签署了一项针对所谓的新能源汽车生产的税收减免法案，在此之后，南非将迎来中国对其价值 270 亿美元的汽车产业的投资。【原文：South Africa is poised for Chinese investment in its $27 billion automotive industry after the president signed a tax break for the production of so-called new-energy vehicles into law.】

item.title: 欧洲准备应对冰雪天气，英国面临黄色预警
item.description: 北欧正面临低温和降雪天气，这不仅增加了取暖需求，也给该地区日益枯竭的天然气库存带来了更大压力。【原文：Northern Europe is facing freezing temperatures and snow, boosting heating demand and putting more pressure on the region’s depleting gas inventories.】

item.title: 超级混合动力车是汽车制造商为电动汽车怀疑论者和好奇者搭建的桥梁
item.description:
梅赛德斯、路虎和丰田等公司都推出了插电式混合动力车，其电动续航里程足以满足日常驾驶需求，同时还配备了汽油动力安全网。【原文：

item.title: 特斯拉 Cybertruck 加入符合美国补贴条件的电动汽车候选名单
item.description: 特斯拉公司的Cybertruck今年首次有资格获得高达7500美元的美国税收抵免，这是根据1月1日生效的更严格规定进行的重新调整的一部分，这些规定也新近取消了其他电动汽车获得联邦补贴的资格。【原文：Tesla Inc.’s Cybertruck qualifies for up to $7,500 in US tax credits for the first time this year, part of reshuffling under tougher rules that took effect on Jan. 1 that also newly disqualify other electric vehicles for federal subsidies.】

item.title: 拜登将在特朗普上任前阻止更多海上石油钻探
item.description: 乔-拜登总统正准备颁布一项法令，永久禁止在美国一些沿海水域开发新的近海石油和天然气，在他入主白宫的最后几周里，锁定对敏感海域难以撤销的保护。【原文：President Joe Biden is preparing to issue a decree permanently banning new offshore oil and gas development in some US coastal waters, locking in difficult-to-revoke protections for sensitive marine areas during his final weeks in the White House.】
